DOC.brief_summary: To assess compare esthetic outcome clinical performance anterior maxillary ceramic implant single crown base either prefabricate zirconia abutment veneer pressed ceramic CAD/CAM ( computer-aided design computer-aided manufacturing ) CARES® abutment veneer hand build-up technique . Participants recruit patient population previously receive dental implant treatment , receive provisional restoration meet inclusion exclusion criterion accord study protocol . After final impression , patient randomise Group A ( prefabricate anatomic abutment ) : one-piece screw retain single crown use press technique ( fluorapatite glass-ceramic , e.max ZirPress ) cut-back technique Group B ( CAD/CAM CARES® abutment ) : one- piece screw retain single crown hand build-up technique ( fluorapatite veneer ceramic , e.max Ceram ) . One week final restoration ( base line visit ) primary secondary outcome parameter assess . The patient follow 5 year final restoration .
DOC.criteria: 1 . Subjects must voluntarily sign informed consent form studyrelated action 2 . Males female least 18 year age 3 . Single tooth gap anterior maxilla position 1424 ( FDI ) 4 . Successfully osseointegrated single tooth implant insert least 16 week tooth extraction 5 . Full mouth plaque index accord O'Leary ≤ 25 % 6 . Implant axis compatible transocclusal screw retention ( screw access palatal incisal edge ) 1 . Systemic disease would interfere dental implant therapy 2 . Any contraindication oral surgical procedure 3 . History local irradiation therapy 4 . Patients smoke > 10 cigarette per day tobacco equivalent chew tobacco 5 . Subjects undergone administration investigational device within 30 day enrolment study 6 . Conditions circumstance , opinion investigator , would prevent completion study participation interfere analysis study result , history noncompliance 7 . Physical mental handicap would interfere ability perform adequate oral hygiene 8 . Pregnant breastfeed woman 9 . Existing implant adjacent position 10 . Removable denture unrestored tooth gap oppose dentition 11 . Patients inadequate oral hygiene unmotivated adequate home care 12 . Probing pocket depth ≥ 4 mm one teeth immediately adjacent dental implant site 13 . Lack primary stability implant 14 . Inappropriate implant position prosthetic requirement 15 . Major simultaneous augmentation procedure 16 . Insufficient stability implant 17 . Screw access position locate close plan incisal edge 18 . Need angled abutment due prosthetic malposition implant 19 . Height abutment le 65 % height complete restoration 20 . Severe bruxing clench habit
